content:
Sure, here are some requirements that can be extracted from the article "Building Identity Graphs over Heterogeneous Data" in table form:

| # | Requirement |
| --- | --- |
| 1 | High-quality, accurate, and up-to-date data sources |
| 2 | Standardized data across all sources |
| 3 | Data integration strategy that allows for bringing together data |
| 4 | Machine learning algorithms for building and maintaining the graph |
| 5 | Graph databases or other suitable storage and querying technologies |
| 6 | Data cleansing, deduplication, and normalization processes |
| 7 | Compliance with data security and privacy regulations and best practices |
| 8 | Ability to handle large-scale data processing |
| 9 | Cross-functional teams that include both data scientists and data engineers |
| 10 | A use case or goal for the identity graph, such as fraud detection, personalization, or customer segmentation |
